content.description: A student plans to conduct an experiment in which the momentum of a two-object system can be determined immediately before and after a collision takes place. The student slides block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an unknown constant speed toward an identical block, block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, that is initially at rest, as shown in the figure. There is negligible friction between the blocks and the surface.
content.question: The student conducts a second experiment in which the magnitude of the force exerted on block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured over the time in which the collision takes place. A graph of the force as a function of time is shown. In a third experiment, the student creates a collision such that the force exerted on block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is constant for <math alttext="0.020 second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.020</mn><mtext>  </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following constant forces, if exerted on block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, would produce the same change in momentum as is shown by the graph?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
